ocrd-gbn-sbb-predict.description: Classifies pixels of input images given a binary (two classes) model and outputs the labels given to each of them as a binary image

model.description: Path to Keras model to be used

shaping.description: How the images must be processed in order to match the input shape of the model ('resize' for resizing to model shape and 'split' for splitting into patches)

type.description: PAGE-XML content type to be predicted

operation_level.description: PAGE-XML hierarchy level to operate on

ocrd-gbn-sbb-binarize.description: Binarizes the input images by predicting the foreground pixels

model.description: Path to Keras model to be used

shaping.description: How the images must be processed in order to match the input shape of the model ('resize' for resizing to model shape and 'split' for splitting into patches)

operation_level.description: PAGE-XML hierarchy level to operate on

ocrd-gbn-sbb-crop.description: Crops the input images (must have been binarized) by predicting the actual page surfaces and setting the out-of-page pixels to background (masking them off)

model.description: Path to Keras model to be used

shaping.description: How the images must be processed in order to match the input shape of the model ('resize' for resizing to model shape and 'split' for splitting into patches)

ocrd-gbn-sbb-segment.description: Segments images by predicting the text regions and lines of the pages (page-level) or by predicting the text lines of the regions (region-level)

region_model.description: Path to Keras model to be used for predicting text regions

region_shaping.description: How the images must be processed in order to match the input shape of the model ('resize' for resizing to model shape and 'split' for splitting into patches)

line_model.description: Path to Keras model to be used for predicting text lines

line_shaping.description: How the images must be processed in order to match the input shape of the model ('resize' for resizing to model shape and 'split' for splitting into patches)
